com.forana.please

Class HTTPRequestFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.forana.please.HTTPRequestFactory

  • public class HTTPRequestFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    Factory that builds HTTPRequest objects, allowing default headers. Further customization can be achieved by extending this class and overriding customize(HTTPRequest).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HTTPRequestFactory()
      Initializes a factory with no base URL.
      HTTPRequestFactory(java.lang.String urlBase)
      Initializes the factory with a base URL.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      HTTPRequestFactory addDefaultHeader(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String value)
      Adds a header to each request created by this factory, effectively calling request.header(name, value) for each.
      protected HTTPRequest customize(HTTPRequest request)
      Apply custom behavior from a subclass to the request being built (or possibly even wrap and return a new HTTPRequest instance, maybe even a subclass).
      HTTPRequest delete(java.lang.String url)
      Start building a DELETE request to a URL.
      HTTPRequest get(java.lang.String url)
      Start building a GET request to a URL.
      HTTPRequest post(java.lang.String url)
      Start building a POST request to a URL.
      HTTPRequest put(java.lang.String url)
      Start building a PUT request to a URL.
      HTTPRequest request(java.lang.String method, java.lang.String url)
      Start building a request to a URL with an arbitrary HTTP method, such as PATCH or HEAD.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HTTPRequestFactory

        public HTTPRequestFactory()
        Initializes a factory with no base URL.

      • HTTPRequestFactory

        public HTTPRequestFactory(java.lang.String urlBase)
        Initializes the factory with a base URL. This base is prepended to the URLs of all requests generated by this factory (useful for REST APIs). For example, a base of "http://example.com" would give a get("/things") request an internal URL to hit of "http://example.com/things".
        Parameters:
        urlBase -

    • Method Detail

      • customize

        protected HTTPRequest customize(HTTPRequest request)
        Apply custom behavior from a subclass to the request being built (or possibly even wrap and return a new HTTPRequest instance, maybe even a subclass). A subclass should override this if it wants to be useful.

      • addDefaultHeader

        public HTTPRequestFactory addDefaultHeader(java.lang.String name,
                                  java.lang.String value)
        Adds a header to each request created by this factory, effectively calling request.header(name, value) for each. Duplicate headers are not supported - subsequent calls with the same name will replace the previous call's value. According to the HTTP spec, duplicate headers are allowed only if the combined values are semantically identical to a comma-separated list of the values. If such a thing is needed, you must combine the values manually.
        Parameters:
        name -
        value -
        Returns:
        this

      • request

        public HTTPRequest request(java.lang.String method,
                  java.lang.String url)
        Start building a request to a URL with an arbitrary HTTP method, such as PATCH or HEAD. Note that unsupported methods (e.g. BREW) may cause an exception in subsequent calls to HTTPRequest.send().

      • get

        public HTTPRequest get(java.lang.String url)
        Start building a GET request to a URL.

      • post

        public HTTPRequest post(java.lang.String url)
        Start building a POST request to a URL.

      • put

        public HTTPRequest put(java.lang.String url)
        Start building a PUT request to a URL.

      • delete

        public HTTPRequest delete(java.lang.String url)
        Start building a DELETE request to a URL.
